Top-3 Scripts:
su_906866: #!/bin/bash
#Convert files using ffmpeg
OrDir="/Volumes/Misc/To Convert 2/"

find "$OrDir" -type f -exec /bin/bash -c \
    'f2=$(basename "$1"); \
     ffmpeg -i "$1" -c:v libx264 -crf 19 -preset slow -c:a aac -strict experimental -b:a 192k -ac 2 "/Volumes/Misc/Converted/${f2%.*}.m4v" ' _ {}  \;

su_556463: ffmpeg -i input.mp4 -c:v libvpx-vp9 -crf 30 -b:v 0 output.webm

ffmpeg -i input.mp4 -c:v libvpx-vp9 -b:v 5M -pass 1 -f webm /dev/null && \
ffmpeg -i input.mp4 -c:v libvpx-vp9 -b:v 5M -pass 2 output.webm

ffmpeg -i input.mp4 -c:v libvpx-vp9 -minrate 5M -maxrate 5M -b:v 5M output.webm

Explanations about Options.-preset:
Configuration preset. This does some automatic settings based on the general type of
 the image.
Explanations about Options.-t:
When used as an input option (before "-i"), limit the duration of data read from the
 input file.
Explanations about Options.-n:
Do not overwrite output files, and exit immediately if a specified output file already
 exists.
